intro: Euphrasia insignis var. idzuensis, commonly known as the Japanese eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. It has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and produces tiny, clustered flowers that attract pollinators like bees and flies. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
